# Mathias Villerabel

> AI Engineer & Data Scientist based in Zurich, Switzerland. Specializes in production ML systems, time series forecasting, computer vision, and large-scale data engineering.

## Most Recent Role

Data Scientist at Swiss Re (Sep 2023 - Jun 2025)
- Built IFRS 17 actuarial/financial simulation engine for regulatory compliance
- Automated end-to-end reconciliation (GL to actuarial models), reducing manual review from days to < 2 hours
- Designed PySpark pipelines in Palantir Foundry scaling to 1 billion+ accounting records per batch

## Previous Experience

Data Scientist at Pernod Ricard, Paris (Jan 2023 - Aug 2023)
- Time-series forecasting (ARIMA, gradient boosting, custom PyTorch framework)
- Improved 3-month demand forecasts by 12% vs. baseline

Research & Applied Scientist at Synspective, Tokyo (Dec 2019 - Jan 2023)
- SAR-based construction detection for urban growth monitoring
- Object detection for maritime trade; 2nd Prize at NEDO Challenge
- Cloud-based Earth observation platform on Google Cloud

ML Intern at National Institute of Informatics, Tokyo (2019)
- Action detection models (MobileNetV2 + LSTM) for UAV systems
- Published in IEEE Access

## Education

Master / Engineering Degree in Computer Science - Sorbonne University (ex UPMC), France
Specialization: Machine Learning, Data Science, Software Engineering

## Key Skills

- Languages: Python (expert), SQL, C/C++, Bash
- ML/DL: PyTorch, TensorFlow, scikit-learn, XGBoost, LightGBM
- Big Data: PySpark, Palantir Foundry
- Cloud: Google Cloud, Azure, AWS SageMaker, Vertex AI
- MLOps: MLflow, Hydra, Optuna, Docker, GitHub Actions
- Domains: Time series forecasting, computer vision, NLP, actuarial modeling, Earth observation

## Portfolio Projects

- Time Series Forecasting at Scale: Production forecasting across retail, rideshare, inventory. 7.1% MAPE on Walmart. PyTorch, MLflow, Optuna, Streamlit.
- Movie Recommendation System: End-to-end with collaborative filtering and deep learning. RMSE ~0.323. Deployed on Hugging Face Spaces.
- Floorplan Wall Segmentation: Semantic segmentation with DeepLabV3. 99.4% accuracy, ONNX export.
